meanings.definition: A person regarded as eccentric or crazy.
meanings.sent1: The kook in our neighborhood always wears mismatched socks.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to that kook; he believes in aliens.
meanings.sent3: The kook at the party was dancing with a lampshade on his head.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were so outlandish, she was considered the kook of the group.
meanings.sent5: The kook's wild theories made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: To act in a strange or eccentric manner.
meanings.sent1: She tends to kook around when she's nervous.
meanings.sent2: Please don't kook during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent3: He decided to kook by wearing a cape to work.
meanings.sent4: The car engine started to kook loudly, alarming the driver.
meanings.sent5: The old clock seemed to kook as it struck midnight.
